result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett M. Alger

records.addlTxt:
11:42 AM   Defendant Brett M. Alger not in court.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Brett M. Alger.  Mr. Alger did not appear as counsel thought this was only going to be scheduling trial dates.  Court informs counsel that he will need to file defendant's request to reject the offers in these matters as soon as possible.  The Court scheduled the matters for trial.
Jury trial scheduled for February 2, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial on February 2, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on July 27, 2022 at 11:40 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:37 PM Defendant Brett M. Alger appeared by video.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared by video for Brett M. Alger. 
INDUCEMENT: Letter dated 4-19-22; Plea to count 2, dismiss and read in all other counts, State to cap its rec at 2 years probation consecutive to 21CF460.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 04-20-22 at 1:30 p.m.  
Minutes.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.
Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant appears, via Zoom, voluntarily on warrant. The matter is continued for initial appearance on 4-4-2022 at 1:30pm in Br.1.  $5,000 recognizance bond previously furnished is continued with all prior conditions. 
MTSO contacted to cancel/return warrant.
Minutes.
2:20 p.m. Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brett M. Alger not in court.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:23 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Brett M. Alger appeared by video. Attorney Brian VanElls making a special appearance by zoon.  The defendant no longer qualifies for public defender.  He will be completing the PFAC forms and filing them.  If he qualified for court appointed counsel, Attorney VanElls would be wiling to be appointed on this matter.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 02-21-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 2-14-2022 in Br. 2 at 1:30pm.  Bail is set at $5,000 recognizance bond with the conditions that he not possess any dangerous weapons and he must maintain absolute sobriety.   Court orders photos and prints at MTSO. 
Minutes.
